intro: Papaver officinale, commonly known as the lesser celandine, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and bright yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits containing numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species in its native habitats.
